description: The '''mangue bit''' or '''manguebeat''' movement is a cultural movement created circa 1991 in the [[city]] of [[Recife]] in Northeast [[Brazil]] in reaction to the cultural and economic stagnation of the city. The movement largely focuses on music, but it has its own fashion and slang, and encompasses aspects of visual art. It mixes regional rhythms of [[Brazilian Northeast]], such as [[maracatu]], [[frevo]], [[Coco (music)|coco]] and [[forr√≥]], with [[Rock music|rock]], [[Soul music|soul]], [[ragga]]muffin, [[hip hop music|hip hop]], [[funk]] and [[electronic music]].
